Request method: GET Request URI: http://localhost:3030/ Proxy: Request params: Query params: Form params: Path params: Multiparts: Headers: Accept=*/* Cookies: Body: HTTP/1.1 200 OK X-Powered-By: Express Access-Control-Allow-Origin: * Content-Type: text/html; charset=utf-8 ETag: W/"c80-LxosfmbJIgZV0Ck3BUPp+1X6XcA" Vary: Accept-Encoding Content-Encoding: gzip Date: Wed, 21 Jul 2021 21:36:38 GMT Connection: keep-alive Keep-Alive: timeout=5 Transfer-Encoding: chunked Best Buy - API Playground

Best Buy - API Playground

Overview

The Best Buy API Playground is a dataset of products, categories, and stores exposed over HTTP via a simple REST API. This application is meant to be a tool used for educational purposes.

Endpoints

  • /products - a subset of ~50,000 products available at Best Buy.
  • /categories - All product categories and their subcategories/path.
  • /stores - A list of all Best Buy store locations.
  • /services - A list of all services available at Best Buy stores.
  • /version - Displays the current version of the application.
  • /healthcheck - Displays the information about the application's health.

Exploring the API

Swagger

  • Swagger config URL: /swagger.json
  • Explore the API via the Swagger UI

Postman Collection

The API can also be explored via a Postman Collection .

  • Import the collection from this URL: /postman/API.postman_collection.json

Querying the API

  • Check out our Example Queries to get an idea of whats possible.
  • All querystrings on GET requests are parsed using qs to turn them into JSON.
  • Nearly all the Sequelize Operators are supported.
    • Use * instead of % for the $like Operators
    • Use $select instead of $attributes for selecting specific fields
    • Use Feathers Pagination and sorting fields ( $limit, $skip, $sort )

Technologies

  • Feathers
  • Sequelize

Attribution

  • Zipcode data provided by geonames.org
  • CSS provided by Skeleton
